channel.title: 乳法怎么突然这么泛滥了

item.title: 乳法怎么突然这么泛滥了[150-200]
item.description: 乳法怎么突然这么泛滥了 我觉得网上某些人乳法都快成神经病了，论敌对度，白皮里也是英美靠前，论拉跨，欧洲比法国烂的不知有多少，热衷辱印度可以理解，如此热衷辱法是什么心理，精神英格兰人？
item.content:encoded:
wuxan94:
龙鼠 发表于 2019-11-7 17:17
列宁格勒一栋楼对抗德国人的时间比法国还长……（真实事件）
快给察里津道歉～

Faerire:
吃太饱
—— 来自 nubia NX595J, Android 7.1.1上的 S1Next-鹅版 v2.1.2

Lzzyf:
台北的基督 发表于 2019-11-7 14:28
法国队1998年前没拿过世界杯冠军，甚至1990年和1994年都没闯入世界杯，那会正是中国家庭电视开始普及的时 ...
心疼

zebra97:
lilyblack 发表于 2019-11-7 09:35
布列斯特要塞，几千人拿着板凳腿，抵抗时间比整个法国还长
一个美国老头去法国旅游，查护照的时候说我上 ...
卧槽，这尼玛真把电影当历史了？布列斯特要塞主要是靠重机枪守住阵地的，还板凳腿？喊乌拉就刀枪不入了还是咋地。而且那时布列斯特要塞在波兰，可不是苏联领土，你觉着很光荣么。

199april:
纯粹就是无聊得闲的
精罗梗还有点好玩 乳法梗就十分恶臭了
我就看不懂这个看不起法国人的风气从哪里来的

lilyblack:
zebra97 发表于 2019-11-7 20:05
卧槽，这尼玛真把电影当历史了？布列斯特要塞主要是靠重机枪守住阵地的，还板凳腿？喊乌拉就刀枪不入了还 ...
1833年沙皇就在布列斯特修要塞了，一战后波兰人把布列斯特搞到手的手段你还觉得很光荣？
德军攻击布列斯特要塞的时候苏军遭到突袭毫无准备，只有部分守军来得及进入阵地，大批守军被分割在营区拿不到武器，电影拍的这个桥段本来就是史实战斗

绿茶与猫:
英国的大清2.0不是更火吗？

didiren:
主要还是水平太低

KA0827:
lilyblack 发表于 2019-11-7 09:53
呵呵
美国人打仗几时用过水泥炸弹？穷B就老实承认，不丢人，沙特这种狗大户打胡塞都打不起，法国扔不起精 ...
也有美国人使用水泥炸弹的新闻
另外水泥炸弹也是精确制导的，只不过没有**靠重力砸死人罢了

Nungesser:
wuxan94 发表于 2019-11-7 15:20
在德军的淫威下……
巴普洛夫大楼里面的23个毛子坚守了两个月，而坐拥百万雄师的髮兰西只比他们少了十几 ...
这种避重就轻的段子谁都会编啊：
为什么巴甫洛夫大楼守了两个月？因为明斯克和基辅早就沦陷了。

ffs:
还有个原因是08奥运圣火传递吧，在欧美各国都受到干扰，但相对美国条子的抱摔法国警察好像表现的不太给力，据说还有被反抢了警棍的？

Nungesser:
199april 发表于 2019-11-7 20:17
纯粹就是无聊得闲的
精罗梗还有点好玩 乳法梗就十分恶臭了
我就看不懂这个看不起法国人的风气从哪里 ...
精罗梗DSSQ是今年的事情，辱髪DSSQ是两、三年前，毫无预兆的突然爆发的，而且玩这种梗的大多还没啥直接目的，比如两个人讨论买车，你说大众我说本田，然后有个人插进来嚷了一句“髪国车也算车？”接下来大家就开始自动辱髪了...

mintpie:
蹲墙角 发表于 2019-11-7 17:15
毕竟有对比 中国在不堪一击也熬到战争结束 法国硬是一击即溃 输的一败涂地 ...
法国要是跟中国一样大，或者德军战斗力跟日军一样，也不会输。

lilyblack:
mintpie 发表于 2019-11-8 09:56
法国要是跟中国一样大，或者德军战斗力跟日军一样，也不会输。
中国也没吹自己是亚洲第一陆军啊，我菜我是打不赢啊，法国吹半天欧洲第一陆军，一个半月就投降了活该被嘲笑。再说当年乳华的还少么？朝鲜战争刚开始，杜鲁门问麦克阿瑟中国参战怎么办，麦克阿瑟怎么回答的？

猫塚猫夫:
今天刚看到个段子：
历史上有哪个政府真正同时实现了德治和法治？
维希政府。

Lzzyf:
猫塚猫夫 发表于 2019-11-8 10:24
今天刚看到个段子：历史上有哪个政府真正同时实现了德治和法治？
绝了

wuxan94:
Nungesser 发表于 2019-11-8 09:48
这种避重就轻的段子谁都会编啊：
为什么巴甫洛夫大楼守了两个月？因为明斯克和基辅早就沦陷了。 ...
呦嘿我大马奇诺～

自旋:
五常里面，打不过美国，英语学多了与英国和美国亲近，而且英国还有女王和贵族可以膜拜，与俄罗斯还得抱团取暖，就剩下一个法国好欺负了。

wuxan94:
mintpie 发表于 2019-11-8 09:56
法国要是跟中国一样大，或者德军战斗力跟日军一样，也不会输。
猜猜当年殖民地面积大哥跟二哥是谁？～

oreobama:
自旋 发表于 2019-11-8 13:10
五常里面，打不过美国，英语学多了与英国和美国亲近，而且英国还有女王和贵族可以膜拜，与俄罗斯还得抱团取 ...
本来大革命吊死贵族在历史书上被评论为历史的进步，结果现代人又活回去舔贵族范了
其实西班牙荷兰也有王室别人就没这么多贵族风的宣传

interzhang:
因为英语在网络上的绝对霸权啊，现在绝大多数乳法梗都是英国佬玩剩下的

Yinacona:
单纯就是营销号带起来的跟风潮，没有别的原因。你问几个玩梗小鬼，楼里提到的几个事件他们除了二战能说出几个？国内这个风气排除没品这种什么都在玩的营销号一直都没什么动静，也就现在村通网了玩梗小鬼发现哦还能这样玩。你要说这几个月法国出了什么和现在乳的相关事件吗，也没有，和楼里说的这些丝毫不相干，我觉得再过个几年就要开始乳英了，天天说脱欧

谷歌街景:
宫崎信者 发表于 2019-11-7 12:14
瞧你这话说的，我琢磨着日本人有段时间入境也是不需要中国签证的，你琢磨琢磨这事儿怎么算 ...
现在日本人进入中华人民共和国也不需要签证——中华人民共和国对本子单方面免签。

Benighted:
用水泥炸弹也值得拿来黑？ 前几天的新闻爆出来荷兰2015年在伊拉克一次空袭炸死70多个平民是不是就能证明它武德充沛了？
最近这波辱法也就是国内垃圾营销号捡4chan10年前玩烂的东西出来刷流量而已

yurejian_2:
没有比法国投降更快的，如果有……

Auver:
现在只要出现法国或白色任一元素就有小鬼出来玩梗
我寻思小鬼们要是能有哪怕一点点英文社区嘲讽的创造力都不会让这个梗落到如此地步

item.title: 乳法怎么突然这么泛滥了[100-150]
item.description: 乳法怎么突然这么泛滥了 我觉得网上某些人乳法都快成神经病了，论敌对度，白皮里也是英美靠前，论拉跨，欧洲比法国烂的不知有多少，热衷辱印度可以理解，如此热衷辱法是什么心理，精神英格兰人？
item.content:encoded:
血满沙场:
yym 发表于 2019-11-7 12:42
每次看到说法国队黑人多就想到nba。。。
说来为啥足球法粉也这么少啊，成绩也不差啊，法国这个国家是不 ...
大概因为国内不转播法甲联赛

yym:
本帖最后由 yym 于 2019-11-7 14:28 编辑
血满沙场 发表于 2019-11-7 14:19
大概因为国内不转播法甲联赛
法甲本身也菜说实话。。。
但是跟这个无关啊，巴甲荷甲有人看吗，巴西荷兰粉丝多不多？不就是国家队成绩和球星带起来的么，然而这个进程在法国身上看不太到

台北的基督:
yym 发表于 2019-11-7 12:42
每次看到说法国队黑人多就想到nba。。。
说来为啥足球法粉也这么少啊，成绩也不差啊，法国这个国家是不 ...
法国队1998年前没拿过世界杯冠军，甚至1990年和1994年都没闯入世界杯，那会正是中国家庭电视开始普及的时候，赶上法国队的低潮期，天生就差了别的强队一截。1998年本土世界杯夺冠算是拉了一波热潮，但本土世界杯夺冠说服力差一截（说的就是你1966年的英格兰），然后2002年年轻球迷进场的时候法国队又一球未进仅积1分小组赛回家2006年齐达内赚了一波情怀，但2010年世界杯就爆出内讧新闻成了笑话法国如今这批妖人起势是在2013年世青赛勇夺冠军，2016年本土欧洲杯本来形势一片大好，结果决赛好死不死对上葡萄牙又好死不死把C罗弄伤下场，就被部分C罗人蜜喷得狗血淋头，结果最后还输了就更只能躺平任人嘲讽2018年这帮小伙子终于夺冠了，那天我这个20年法国球迷老泪纵横然后网上就又开始黑我法都是黑人只会打防守反击胜之不武，反正这么多年了都习惯了，我法球迷又少又佛系，随他去吧。
—— 来自 HUAWEI HMA-AL00, Android 9上的 S1Next-鹅版 v2.1.2

yym:
台北的基督 发表于 2019-11-7 14:28
法国队1998年前没拿过世界杯冠军，甚至1990年和1994年都没闯入世界杯，那会正是中国家庭电视开始普及的时 ...
总结下来就是出成绩的时机不对么。。。

mintpie:
欧洲搞了七次反法同盟，法国居然赢了五次，就凭这个，欧洲没有一个国家有资格嘲笑法国。二战被占领算是一次大失败，但是也就被占领了5年。中国上一次被外族占领可是占领了300年。
至于说科学家文学家哲学家艺术家，法国对于人类文明的贡献更是不虚任何其他国家。

血满沙场:
yym 发表于 2019-11-7 14:27
法甲本身也菜说实话。。。
但是跟这个无关啊，巴甲荷甲有人看吗，巴西荷兰粉丝多不多？不就是国家队成绩 ...
巴西人阿根廷人荷兰人我都是在意甲西甲英超认识的

台北的基督:
yym 发表于 2019-11-7 14:32
总结下来就是出成绩的时机不对么。。。
出成绩的时候错过了国内球迷的积累期，国内球迷关注度最高的时候直播拉裤子，动不动配点内讧的负面新闻，多年低潮后最值得关注的时候又得罪了人蜜……你看看你看看，我法这么说出来好像也挺值得一乳的
—— 来自 HUAWEI HMA-AL00, Android 9上的 S1Next-鹅版 v2.1.2

wxshaonv2000:
泥潭为反而反 居然涌现出这么多法吹 真是奇景了

yym:
血满沙场 发表于 2019-11-7 14:34
巴西人阿根廷人荷兰人我都是在意甲西甲英超认识的
是呀，自家联赛小透明不妨碍国家队有一堆粉对不对，然而法国不是

mintpie:
luoguliu 发表于 2019-11-7 12:53
美国为何要黑法国啊？
法国外交上一向比较自主，包括而不局限于：
退出北约（后来又加入）
与中国建交（第一个西方大国）
谴责伊拉克战争
试图组建“欧洲军”
美国能给法国好脸色？

yym:
台北的基督 发表于 2019-11-7 14:37
出成绩的时候错过了国内球迷的积累期，国内球迷关注度最高的时候直播拉裤子，动不动配点内讧的负面新闻， ...
写个惨字。。。

Nungesser:
其实嘛，论辱，辱得最厉害最戳痛处的，其实一直是法国人自己，不管是文学还是艺术作品，但是当下中文网络世界的所谓乳髮呢？实在是水平太低，要么就是几十年前英语世界传烂了的屎湿级烂梗，要么就是看到白色就自动带入“法国国旗”之类的低等动物式的条件反射，再往后连B站的音乐演奏视频都能带进来DSSQ了（理由居然是视频中的乐器是法国号），一群蝗虫COS复读机的画面不要太美。

藤井紫:
wxshaonv2000 发表于 2019-11-7 14:38
泥潭为反而反 居然涌现出这么多法吹 真是奇景了
而且神秘的是为了反乳法还要让中国人自己跪下

Nungesser:
哦对，DSSQ了十几个月下来的结果就是：一来真有不少人信了法国国旗是纯白、二来真有人当着法国人的面说“你们只会投降”之类的话（貌似还是老师对学生）。反正这种烂梗无脑玩下去，最大输家不是髮国，而是某些人的脑子罢了。

Duke:
美国人经常说一个乳法的段子，大意是美国人去欧洲旅游，听见法国人说美国又在发动战争，是人类和平的威胁云云，于是上前问那个法国人会说德语吗，答曰不会，美国人表示“不用谢了！”。
其实我觉得法国人也很好反击，只要问美国人的国旗是什么就行了，然后一样可以说不用谢。

cools:
乳法可以乳但是目前的乳法内容忒无聊了，基本就是10年前英语网络老梗的反刍
在中文网络突然泛滥开的原因有人说是手游圈传开的有人说是军宅圈传开的，不过其实没啥区别，主要是自传播自媒体实在缺梗了就盯上了这个，已经开始变得无趣了

18300625949:
法吹脸皮太厚，还喜欢辱德，七年战争西班牙王位战争这种输了战争都吹上天了

血翼龙:
挺傻逼的，吃屎都吃二手白皮的，其实戴高乐对我国可不差吧。整天吵吵老外的刻版印象，自己倒是学的挺快

robertjiong:
之前看到一位台湾友人提出一个观点 法国是在西方阵营里面区别于白盎的一支 本身可以成为独立的势力的 辱法白盎是最狠的 当然本身法国人不争气 现在又站在西方这个大立场下没自己立场了

kuputaer:
不过军宅键政局之流也算是网上最弱智的群体之一了 搞出这种玩意也不稀奇

林登·万:
说明盎宣队厉害 万年老梗来回嚼

wuxan94:
martinhe 发表于 2019-11-7 09:24
后知后觉，求发点乳法的段子看看
在德军的淫威下……
巴普洛夫大楼里面的23个毛子坚守了两个月，而坐拥百万雄师的髮兰西只比他们少了十几天～

天堂蜘蛛:
拿着近代共和国跟封建王朝比下限，到底谁在乳法啊。

wuxan94:
mintpie 发表于 2019-11-7 14:33
欧洲搞了七次反法同盟，法国居然赢了五次，就凭这个，欧洲没有一个国家有资格嘲笑法国。二战被占领算是一次 ...
你心目中的髮兰西正统算尼安德特人还是特洛伊难民还是日耳曼蛮子还是非洲黑蜀黍？～

mintpie:
wuxan94 发表于 2019-11-7 15:26
你心目中的髮兰西正统算尼安德特人还是特洛伊难民还是日耳曼蛮子还是非洲黑蜀黍？～ ...
全世界的正统都是非洲猴子，然后呢？你想说什么？

dybang:
就是玩烂梗呗 精罗梗热度才开始退

lilyblack:
cools 发表于 2019-11-7 14:53
乳法可以乳但是目前的乳法内容忒无聊了，基本就是10年前英语网络老梗的反刍
在中文网络突然泛滥开的原因有 ...
苏联政治笑话还是四五十年的老梗呢，不也一堆人玩
我说别人玩个梗自己乐呵一下，又没吃你们家大米，一个个义愤填膺个什么劲？

wuxan94:
mintpie 发表于 2019-11-7 15:31
全世界的正统都是非洲猴子，然后呢？你想说什么？
欧罗巴民族征服史本来就是烂账你说髮兰西哪个是本族哪个是外族～

KOGmk2:
本帖最后由 KOGmk2 于 2019-11-7 16:19 编辑
灰狼 发表于 2019-11-7 09:40
其实真正有资格乳法的也就是五常里那几个吧
论实力大阴蒂也不行,账面上法鸡实力和鹰兔熊是一个档次,都是三位一体满功率,比起连密码都由美人希代管的大阴蒂整整高了一档

cools:
lilyblack 发表于 2019-11-7 15:43
苏联政治笑话还是四五十年的老梗呢，不也一堆人玩
我说别人玩个梗自己乐呵一下，又没吃你们家大米，一个 ...
矫情什么，没人说你们不许玩烂梗，只不过别人也有评价这种无聊行为的权利，网络公共空间就这样咯

Realplayer:
泥潭不许提政治，我就问问08奥运会的事大家都忘了没

stmule:
風駿 发表于 2019-11-7 09:10
别的国家不好玩啊，这种具有谐星气质的国家哪里找
隔壁的印度，邻居家的孩子韩国

FUZE:
东南亚农民
欧罗巴警察
谁会赢？

瓦米里奥:
纵观英法德法鸡确实还是对华稍微好点的，无奈08年奥运那次太败好感

塩天使リエル:
本帖最后由 塩天使リエル 于 2019-11-7 16:40 编辑

差格社会差格社会
再来个中国原创乳法段子：
陈赓在他的日记里这样写道，“越南和法帝真是一对绝妙的对手，两方的战斗力都不相上下。法军从未主动冲过锋，每次都是摆着挨打的架子。越南部队行动之迟缓，动作之不积极，均出我意料之外。因此，每次战斗几乎都形成相持局面。假若越方战斗力提高一步，法帝必遭驱逐无疑。”

item.title: 乳法怎么突然这么泛滥了[50-100]
item.description: 乳法怎么突然这么泛滥了 我觉得网上某些人乳法都快成神经病了，论敌对度，白皮里也是英美靠前，论拉跨，欧洲比法国烂的不知有多少，热衷辱印度可以理解，如此热衷辱法是什么心理，精神英格兰人？

同一年的 ...
水泥炸弹本来就是要减少附带损伤的，你在城区扔1000磅炸弹？还是说利比亚战争不需要考虑平民伤亡问题了。髮国人要是在奥德赛黎明期间全部丢的是水泥炸弹我也无话可说，可是我找不到证据。
如果没有水泥炸弹需要打击的目标，自然可以使用普通炸弹。

说的好像科索沃战争美国人没在南斯拉夫城区扔炸弹一样

xwr:
本帖最后由 xwr 于 2019-11-7 10:19 编辑
03年伊拉克战争期间大嘤台风使用1000磅制导水泥弹，能摧毁坦克之类的装甲目标，可以有效减小连带损伤，特别是在建筑密集的城区。
Last Updated:Friday, 4 April, 2003, 22:05 GMT 23:05 UK
Tornados to drop 'concrete bombs'
By Mark Nicholls
With the RAF at the Ali Al Salem airbase in northern Kuwait
Tornado jets are poised to use yet another different weapon in the war against Iraq ... concrete bombs.
The jets, normally based at RAF Marham in Norfolk, have already used high-tech weaponry such as the "bunker busting" cruise missile Storm Shadow, which cost £750,000 apiece and can pierce several feet of concrete.
But now the crews operating over Iraq from the Ali Al Salem airbase in northern Kuwait are about to go to the opposite extreme and use "inert bombs".
These are basically blocks of concrete shaped as bombs and painted blue to identify them as non-explosive if they are discovered still intact after the war.
Great accuracy
But they will be laser-guided 1,000lb blocks of concrete, capable of destroying a tank or artillery piece, but without causing a devastating explosion that would put civilians at risk and shatter surrounding buildings.
Tornado Detachment commander, Group Captain Simon Dobb, said: "We have the option of using these inert bombs.
"They still have the guidance and steering methods of other high explosive weapons but the risk of causing civilian casualties is greatly reduced."
The weapons, dropped from height and with great accuracy, can destroy a tank without affecting surrounding buildings.
The weapon is on standby if Saddam Hussein moves his tanks and artillery pieces further into Baghdad, hiding them in areas of dense population.
It means the Tornados can still destroy them but leave civilian buildings intact and the population unscathed.
He said: "There is the impact, without a massive explosive effect.
"It's all about proportionality."
Coloured blue
The Tornado already has a wide arsenal: from air-to-air Sidewinder missiles; laser- and GPS-guided Paveway bombs; dumb bombs; Storm Shadow and ALARM anti-radiation missiles.
It has dropped controversial cluster bombs during this war, though only on specific targets of troops concentrations and military vehicles.
Tornado
Factfile: Tornado
The Tornados have continued to fly missions offering close air support to ground forces as they advance on Baghdad and are now ready to play a role if the war moves into the streets of the Iraqi capital.
Plans are already in hand for post-war Iraq, though the role of the Tornados in that is still undecided.
They may have a presence during the reconstruction of Iraq, maintaining security in Iraqi air space, particularly as humanitarian aid is flown in.
They may maintain a presence in Iraq until the country achieves a stability and has a stable government, and is able to defend its territorial boundaries by itself.
There has been speculation the Tornados may move to bases within Iraq, though that is unlikely at this stage.
But that may change in coming weeks or months.
This is pooled copy from Mark Nicholls, of the Eastern Daily Press, with the RAF at the Ali Al Salem airbase in northern Kuwait.

U.S. Wields Defter Weapon Against Iraq: Concrete Bomb
By Steven Lee Myers
Oct. 7, 1999
See the article in its original context from October 7, 1999, Section A, Page 3
American fighter jets patrolling northern Iraq are using an innovative new weapon against President Saddam Hussein: concrete.
Wary of killing civilians, the Air Force has begun filling 2,000-pound, laser-guided bombs with concrete instead of explosives and dropping them on military targets near populated areas, American military officials here said.
A concrete bomb, the use of which has not previously been disclosed, can still destroy a target, but minimizes the risk that explosive bomb fragments will kill or wound innocent Iraqis who might be nearby.
''It can stub your toe,'' Lieut. Col. Michael S. Waters, a spokesman for the American operation here in this base near the Mediterranean, said of the concrete. ''But there's no chance of collateral damage,'' he added, using the military's euphemism for civilian deaths.
That makes it useful against military targets Iraq has positioned in residential neighborhoods in what American officials believe is Mr. Hussein's main objective in challenging the ''no flight'' zones over northern and southern Iraq: to foment international sympathy by publicizing civilian casualties.
The concrete bombs are also an apt symbol of a low-level war against Iraq that is dictated as much by political and diplomatic sensitivities as strategic or military concerns.
In what has become the longest sustained military operation since Vietnam, for more than nine months now Iraqi forces have routinely fired on the American and British jets that patrol the zones, and the American and British crews have routinely struck back. But it is a deliberately low-key war.
''The way we're conducting this is kept within the parameters of political acceptability,'' said a senior Clinton Administration official. ''We don't want things to go wrong.''
And so pilots here at Incirlik (pronounced in-JER-lick) fly into combat with strict rules about what, when, where and how they may attack.
The Turkish Government, wary of public sentiment about the repeated air strikes, limits the number of days the jets can fly and prohibits night operations. The United States European Command, which oversees operations here, has put northern Iraq's most significant military targets off limits, fearing international outrage over any escalation of the fighting.
Above all, the pilots must avoid mistakes that could play into Mr. Hussein's hand. ''It's between none and minimal collateral damage that we'll accept,'' said Maj. Hugh Hanlon, an F-16CJ pilot stationed here.
The result is something of a standoff. The American and British forces have struck more than five times the number of targets attacked during four days of intensive strikes against Iraq last December and flown more than three-quarters as many combat missions as NATO pilots did during 78 days of bombing Yugoslavia.
The Iraqis say nearly 200 people, including many civilians, have been killed. American officials say that claim is exaggerated but they acknowledge people have been killed.
American military commanders say the air strikes have inflicted severe damage to Iraq's air defenses. But they have not yet hit Iraqi forces hard enough to persuade the Government to stop resisting.
Commanders here and at the Pentagon say the strikes will end as soon as Iraq stops firing on the patrols, even though they acknowledge that Iraq has the ability to resist this way for the foreseeable future.
''It's reached a stalemate,'' said Group Capt. Graham P. Dixon, commander of the 200 British troops and six aircraft involved in the operations at Incirlik. ''I'm not sure there can be a way around this as long as Saddam Hussein is in power. I personally see this as a long-term proposition, not a short-term one.''
America and its allies created the zones after the Persian Gulf war in 1991 to protect Iraqi Kurds in the north and Shiite Muslims in the south from Iraqi forces. Officials in Washington say the zones remain important to isolate Mr. Hussein.
Iraq never accepted the zones, but American and allied jets patrolled them largely unmolested for more than seven years. Then last December, the United States and Britain carried out four days of attacks to punish Mr. Hussein for refusing to allow the United Nations to continue inspections of his nuclear, chemical and biological weapons programs.
Iraqi forces have since challenged virtually every patrol, firing antiaircraft weapons, launching surface-to-air missiles and sending MIG jets darting into the zones.
While American officials decline to discuss their tactics in depth, including how or how long they have been using the concrete bombs, they do offer a stunning list of statistics.
Since December, they say, American and British patrols have flown nearly 16,000 sorties and dropped 550 bombs against 135 targets in southern Iraq. Here at Incirlik, they have flown more than 11,000 combat or combat-support sorties and dropped more than 1,100 bombs against more than 250 targets.
Those targets have included more than 150 antiaircraft artillery batteries, 30 radar or communication centers and 22 buildings used as command centers, said Brig. Gen. David A. Deptula, the Air Force commander here until last week.
The air war has been decidedly one-sided. Iraqi forces have yet to hit an American or British aircraft, American officials said.
According to American intelligence reports, Iraq has withdrawn its most sophisticated weapons from the no-flight zones in recent months to protect them.
But that has not stopped Iraq from firing back with antiaircraft artillery. That still poses a threat, though much less of one since, the pilots and commanders say, the jets flying into northern Iraq stay high enough that they are less likely to be hit. Iraq has also positioned its remaining antiaircraft batteries in residential neighborhoods in or near the northern Iraqi cities like Mosul and Tall'Afar.
General Deptula said that after American jets destroyed Iraq's main air-defense command center south of Mosul, the Iraqis moved their headquarters to the nearby historic ruins of Nineveh, the ancient capital of Assyria built in the seventh century B.C. -- a target presumably off limits.
An American Government official with access to the intelligence reports said Iraq's tactics had significantly diminished its chances of hitting an aircraft, but were still accomplishing Mr. Hussein's goal of drawing attention to the patrols.
''He's trying to provoke us to do something, but he's trying to do in such a way he doesn't lose assets,'' the official said. ''The ultimate intention of what Saddam Hussein is trying to do in the 'no fly' zones is not military.''
The tactics on both sides -- including the concrete bombs -- have turned the conflict into an odd game of cat-and-mouse.
The United States has about 50 aircraft in the operation, from fighter jets to combat support. When they fly, they take off in one long, loud procession. Once they reach the border, about an hour away, only the fighter jets enter Iraq. The others fly over the khaki-colored mountains of eastern Turkey, out of harm's way.
On a mission today, pilots reported seeing 57-millimeter antiaircraft fire, bursting in distinctive gray puffs 15,000 to 18,000 feet up, well beneath the jets.
Pilots and commanders here say they try to respond. But from more than 20,000 feet, it is often impossible to see an artillery battery -- no larger than a truck and often hiding in orchards or towns -- and in those cases they attack other targets.
Under their rules of engagement, the pilots most often strike at parts of Iraq's air defenses, including radio towers, radar stations and command centers that, according to the Pentagon, coordinate the Iraqi attacks.
Today the F-16C's and the F-15's attacked separate targets at a communications center they had decided to hit in advance if threatened.
France and Russia have criticized the strikes, and there are signs the strategy hampers United Nations Security Council negotiations over creating a new weapons inspection program in Iraq. A senior defense official said the Russians had tried to condition their support of new inspections on an end to the strikes.
''Our mission has not changed,'' General Deptula said. ''The only thing that has changed is the threat, and we are employing ordinance to respond to that threat. But the larger question of the efficacy of the no-flight zones is a political one.''
